oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Buena Vista Band, from the Nashville Times, 1940
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A published photo of children in the Buena Vista Band, from the Nashville Times (1940). The school site was located northwest of downtown Nashville. The name “Buena Vista” relates to the home name of John L. Beck and his wife Lavinia, when they built a two-story frame house on top of a lush hill two miles northwest of downtown circa 1812. Forms part of the Nashville Times newspaper collection. 1 digital photo.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Buena Vista Enhanced Option School (Nashville, Tenn.)--History--Sources
